name: Kidnapped
description: Kidnapped is a psychological story-driven horror game, featuring emphasis on exploration, puzzle solving and combat. Kidnapped dynamically changes as the player progresses, and aims to unnerve the player. Traverse a two hundred year old manor, dark damp caves, an eerie forest and more.

reviews.review_text: Way too many (game breaking) bugs and the last update/patch was in August. Game seems to be abandoned.  In this state it wasn't even worth the buck that I paid for it, so it was a refund for me.
I thought the narrator sounded like Weird Al. Later, I found a VHS tape of Weird Al. Coincidence...or conspiracy?  This is the world of Kidnapped.

At the time of writing, I haven't beat the game, but I think I've seen enough of it to give you all an honest review. Kidnapped isn't a good game, and here's why.   Nothing in the game really stands out.  If you're familiar with the horror genre, you've already seen it all: Vaguely creepy sound effects, strange monsters that try to chase you, crazy notes lying around, etc. It tries very hard to be scary, but a lot of it just comes off as cheap jumpscares. No unique mechanics, no interesting story, nothing.   Story is absolute nonsense.  From what I can tell, you're some random person who's been kidnapped (hence the name). You're never told why. It starts off in a dark mansion in chapter 1, then it's a cave in chapter 2, and then you're in the middle of the woods in chapter 3. None of it makes sense!   Full of bugs.  Hitboxes are awful, invisible walls are everywhere, and sometimes you'll die for no reason. I shouldn't be shooting an enemy at point-blank range and not even hitting it!   It's about what you would expect for $2.99. Certainly better than some of the other games on offer for the same price, but nothing remarkable.
The game is terribly optimized and you can not edit anything besides some basic graphics settings. You can not rebind keys or change mouse sensitivity. I would not reccomend buying the game at all.

All in all this game was awesome! it scared the hell outta me several times. So be aware of that. The atmosphere was great, there are a couple of puzzles that are really really hard to figure out, there is really no reason or rhyme to them. but other then that it is a great game!

Quick review:  Positives: +atmosphere  Negatives: -everything else  ---  First of all, the game runs pretty horribly.  My PC isn't _that_ bad and sometimes the game would just lag horribly when I ran into objects for example. The atmosphere at least was pretty good and the couple of jump scares got me that I managed to see... Before the game crashed at the end of Chapter 1. Everything was feeling pretty tedious already and I wasn't really that immersed in the game, because it felt so clunky so that was enough for me. I didn't hear enough of the narration to have much of an opinion, but let's say I've heard a lot worse.  Maybe if the game ran better, your character could actually run (run key makes you go like 10% faster compared to your sloooooooooow normal speed) and the crashing issue was fixed this could've been something. But as it is, it's not even worth 3€ as I got bored after like 30mins of playing (until the game crashed), which felt like 1,5 hours.  Luckily I didn't pay a penny for this, as I got the key for free from a giveaway.
Really nice game, fairly hard but I liked it! It's got a lot of stuff to think about and it really nice.

I would totally recommend this game! However, it is a bit glitchy. For starters, it seems to constantly lag (this could be just my computer, but my brother seems to have the same problem as well on his) but the animals in the forest get 'stuck' when they are either attacking or fleeing, and my character freezes and gets stuck a lot as well, and secondly *spoiler* when you have to find the key to the church, it won't allow me to push the fake gravestone the correct way to get the key from underneath it. If those things get fixed, It would be an A++ game.

After finishing the game and seeing the ending, i doubt that . It's not scary at all . Besides i would call this game a real con. In the trailer you see ennemies that never show up in the game. Forget this game and give a beggar your money instead.
